verses.verse: Praise to God, the Ruler of the Earth To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. [1] Oh, clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of triumph!
For the LORD Most High is awesome; He is a great (Deut. 7:21; Neh. 1:5; Ps. 76:12) King over all the earth.
(Ps. 18:47) He will subdue the peoples under us, And the nations under our feet.
He will choose our ((1 Pet. 1:4)) inheritance for us, The excellence of Jacob whom He loves. Selah
(Ps. 68:24, 25) God has gone up with a shout, The LORD with the sound of a trumpet.
Sing praises to God, sing praises! Sing praises to our King, sing praises!
(Zech. 14:9) For God is the King of all the earth; (1 Cor. 14:15) Sing praises with understanding.
(1 Chr. 16:31) God reigns over the nations; God (Ps. 97:2) sits on His (Ps. 48:1) holy throne.
The princes of the people have gathered together, ((Rom. 4:11, 12)) The people of the God of Abraham. ((Ps. 89:18)) For the shields of the earth belong to God; He is greatly exalted.
The Glory of God in Zion A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. [1] Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised In the (Ps. 46:4; 87:3; Matt. 5:35) city of our God, In His holy mountain.
(Ps. 50:2) Beautiful in elevation, The joy of the whole earth, Is Mount Zion on the sides of the north, The city of the great King.
God is in her palaces; He is known as her refuge.
For behold, (2 Sam. 10:6, 14) the kings assembled, They passed by together.
They saw it, and so they marveled; They were troubled, they hastened away.
